title.bibl: Daily Jewish Courier, June 28, 1918. Red Cross Stamps of One Cent and Up

div.bibl: Daily Jewish Courier, June 28, 1918. RED CROSS STAMPS OF ONE CENT AND UP

body.p: Upon the request of the Jewish peddlers, there will now be issued Red Cross Stamps of one cent and up. Hitherto, the smallest stamp was twenty-five cents. The peddlers may obtain these stamps at the Blue Island Savings Bank, Twelfth Street and Blue Island Avenue.
The peddlers are doing very fine work for the Red Cross by paying for the stuff which they buy, with Red Cross Stamps.
